content:
This just released a few days ago:

COVID-19 Guidance for Hospital Reporting and FAQs
For Hospitals, Hospital Laboratory, and Acute Care Facility Data Reporting
https://www.hhs.gov/sites/default/files/covid-19-faqs-hospitals-hospital-laboratory-acute-care-facility-data-reporting.pdf

Relevant to all things S.A.N.E.R.
Not news, so much as politics and stupidity. It's the CDC reports refactored to take CDC out of the picture, and switch it to Teletracking.

Well, there's a few new things in there. Medication tracking and staffing levels, for instance. I don't recall those being in the last version of the implementation guide; and our previous MeasureReports certainly weren't tracking them. Also, with HHS assuming control of the reporting, they may actually have more resources. I feel like they're more likely to put a SANER hub in place than CDC at this point.
So, now that the CDC data has been taken down, do we know where HHS will be hosting it?

Apparently the new HHS website hit the news yesterday:
https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/20/hhs-unveils-new-coronavirus-hospitalization-database-says-its-more-complete-than-cdcs.html

Hospital Capacity Data
https://protect-public.hhs.gov/pages/hospital-capacity

COVID-19 Estimated Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by State
https://healthdata.gov/dataset/covid-19-estimated-patient-impact-and-hospital-capacity-state

AMIA fires back....

An Open Letter from the American Medical Informatics Association
Regarding Public Health Reporting Deficiencies During the COVID-19 Pandemic
